newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: BCP sees 3.2 pct financial margin 1997.
newsitem.headline: BCP sees 3.2 pct financial margin 1997.

text.p: The Banco Comercial Portugues group expects to be able to sustain a financial margin of around 3.2 percent, the level achieved in the first quarter of the year, a senior official said.
The margin compared with 3.0 percent in the first quarter of 1996, director of investor relations, Rui Lopes, told a news conference.
The average for the Portuguese banking sector as a whole is around 2.9 percent.

Officials said that the improvement raised financial margin income -- the difference between how much a bank pays and how much it charges for funds -- to 31.8 billion escudos from 35.1 billion in the same period 1996.
The group earned 1.9 billion escudos from asset sales in the first quarter of 1997, Lopes added.
The company said the policy of selling non-strategic investments to concentrate on its financial activities would continue.
It said that negotiations were well advanced for the sale of hotels in the southern Algarve region. --Lisbon bureau 3511-3150035
